review:
AxiomPay steps into the ring with a bold promise: to bring privacy to stablecoin payments on Ethereum, a network where every transaction is laid bare for all to see. The project’s mission is clear—shield users, both individuals and institutions, from the prying eyes of surveillance capitalism and on-chain analytics. This is a cause worth fighting for! But comrades, we must not be blinded by rhetoric alone. We must demand evidence, structure, and a plan that serves the many, not the few.

Let’s start with the strengths. AxiomPay identifies a real, pressing problem: the lack of privacy in stablecoin transactions. They propose a technical solution that combines zero-knowledge proofs, homomorphic encryption, and MPC-based view keys. This is not just talk—they claim their core smart contracts are already complete, and they plan to use funds for audits and building user/business-facing tools. The project is open source, aligning with our values of transparency and collective ownership.

But let’s not mince words: there are glaring weaknesses. The application is light on measurable outcomes. Where are the metrics? Where is the evidence that this protocol will be adopted, that it will work at scale, that it will be regulatory compliant in practice and not just in theory? The roadmap is vague—"develop an app and SDK" is not a plan, it’s a wish. There is no deployment yet, no user numbers, no partnerships, no pilot studies. The project’s claims of regulatory compliance are unsubstantiated. And while the technical approach is promising, there is no discussion of sustainability—how will this project survive without endless grants? Where is the plan for community governance, for equitable access, for serving the underserved?

AxiomPay, you have the seeds of a revolution, but you must show us the harvest. We demand:
- Clear, measurable milestones and outcomes.
- Evidence of regulatory engagement and compliance.
- A sustainable revenue model.
- A detailed, structured roadmap with timelines and deliverables.
- A plan for community governance and equitable access.

Without these, we risk funding another experiment that serves the few, not the many. The Ethereum commons deserves better. Rise to the challenge!

strengths.title: Addresses a Critical Privacy Gap
strengths.description: AxiomPay tackles the real and urgent problem of privacy in stablecoin payments, a barrier to mainstream adoption for both individuals and institutions.

strengths.title: Innovative Technical Approach
strengths.description: The project proposes a combination of zero-knowledge proofs, homomorphic encryption, and MPC-based view keys, showing technical ambition and awareness of current privacy limitations.

strengths.title: Open Source Commitment
strengths.description: AxiomPay’s code is public, aligning with open-source and collective ownership principles essential for public goods infrastructure.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Metrics
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear, quantifiable goals, adoption targets, or evidence of impact, making it difficult to assess potential success.

weaknesses.title: Unsubstantiated Claims of Regulatory Compliance
weaknesses.description: While regulatory compliance is claimed, there is no evidence of engagement with regulators or legal analysis provided.

weaknesses.title: No Deployment or User Evidence
weaknesses.description: The project has not yet deployed on mainnet or testnet, and there are no user numbers, partnerships, or pilot studies to demonstrate traction.

weaknesses.title: Vague Roadmap and Sustainability Plan
weaknesses.description: The roadmap lacks detail, timelines, and deliverables. There is no discussion of how the project will sustain itself beyond grant funding.

changes.title: Define Measurable Milestones and Outcomes
changes.description: Provide specific, quantifiable goals (e.g., number of users, transactions, audits completed) and a plan for tracking and reporting progress.

changes.title: Demonstrate Regulatory Engagement
changes.description: Include evidence of legal review, regulatory engagement, or compliance strategy to substantiate claims of regulatory alignment.

changes.title: Deploy and Report Early Results
changes.description: Deploy the protocol on a testnet or mainnet, and provide data on usage, user feedback, and technical performance.

changes.title: Develop a Detailed Roadmap and Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Present a structured roadmap with clear timelines, deliverables, and a plan for long-term sustainability, including potential revenue models and community governance structures.
